intro: Schlechteranthus abruptus, commonly known as the abrupt mountainflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh mountain climates. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, with a compact structure that aids in pollination by insects. Schlechteranthus abruptus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in alpine ecosystems.
